text:
I was trying some things out and got an error. Does LoopVectorization not support a loop of the form
```function mymean4(func,iter)
    len = length(iter)
    total = zero(eltype(iter))
    @avx for i in iter
        total += func(i)
    end
    total/len
end```
It gives this error
`ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching canonicalize_range(::Vector{Float64})`

elements.text: I was trying some things out and got an error. Does LoopVectorization not support a loop of the form

function mymean4(func,iter)
    len = length(iter)
    total = zero(eltype(iter))
    @avx for i in iter
        total += func(i)
    end
    total/len
end
ERROR: LoadError: MethodError: no method matching canonicalize_range(::Vector{Float64})

text: The avx macro can't see inside `fun`, so if the function isn't something avx knows about it can't do much here

elements.text: The avx macro can't see inside
, so if the function isn't something avx knows about it can't do much here

text:
I dont think thats it since this code runs just fine.
```function mymean4(func,iter)
    len = length(iter)
    total = zero(eltype(iter))
    @avx for i in 1:len
        total += func(iter[i])
    end
    total/len
end```

elements.text: I dont think thats it since this code runs just fine.

function mymean4(func,iter)
    len = length(iter)
    total = zero(eltype(iter))
    @avx for i in 1:len
        total += func(iter[i])
    end
    total/len
end

text: yeah I don't think `avx` supports general iterators
Yeah. You could file an issue, since there is nothing theoretically stopping it from converting the first into the second automatically

elements.text: Yeah. You could file an issue, since there is nothing theoretically stopping it from converting the first into the second automatically
